subject: Re: [junit] remove test from suite?
msgSnippet: ... If I read between the lines I can imagine that the only problem you may have is that a run failes and the error message is No tests found in ... (if
messageBody:
> hi, is there any easy way to remove a test from a suite? i am fooling
> around with cactus and some of the tests are not implemented yet.


If I read between the lines I can imagine that the only problem you may
have is that a run failes and the error message is ""No tests found in
..." (if it's not the problem, please give more infos)

cause of this problem: classes that extend TestCase _must_ have at least
one valid test method (public, void return, no arg and beginning with
"test").

Several solutions:

- create an empty dummy test method:
public void testDummy () {}
- find the testsuite that includes this class and remove the
addTestSuite(myFaultyClass.class) call
- modify JUnit to implement a soft-error handling: if an error message
starts with "xyz", consider this as a warning and not as an error (in
TestResult).

public void runProtected(final Test test, Protectable p) {
try {
p.protect();
} catch (AssertionFailedError e) {
if (e.getMessage().startsWith("No tests found in")) {
System.out.println("warning " + e.getMessage());
} else {
addFailure(test, e);
}
} catch (ThreadDeath e) { // don't catch ThreadDeath by accident
throw e;
} catch (Throwable e) {
addError(test, e);
}
}

Did I mentioned that it was ugly? :-)

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
